A great deal of time spent in activities to get the substance, taking the substance, or recovering from its effects:

Frequent intoxication with withdrawal symptoms when expected to fulfill major role obligations at work, school, or home:

a. Have you ever been high or sick from drugs when you were supposed to go to school, work, take care of responsibilities, or drive (not applicable for 12-15)?  Did you ever stay home because of being high, sick, or hung over?

OR Recurrent use in situations in which use is physically hazardous:

b. Have you ever done anything reckless or dangerous while you were high?  Have you ever driven a car/boat/bike while you were high? (Probe for arrests, speeding tickets, DWI, etc.)  Have you ever done anything that put you or someone else in danger while you were on drugs?
INTERVIEWER: If no, SKIP to Important Social, Occupational.

Field Label:
Important social, occupational, or recreation activities given up or reduced because of substance abuse:

a. Have you ever been using drugs so much that you started to use drugs instead of going to school or working or spending time at hobbies or with family or friends?
INTERVIEWER: If no, SKIP to Continued Substance Use
b. With which drugs has that happened? (see below)

Continued substance use despite knowledge of having a persistent or recurrent social, psychological, or physical problem that is caused or exacerbated by the use of the substance.

a. Have you continued to use drugs even when it caused problems?  For example, at school, or with friends or family, the law, or your health?
INTERVIEWER: If no, SKIP to Marked Tolerance.
b. With which drug(s) has that happened? (see below)

Marked Tolerance: Need for markedly increased amounts of the substance in order to achieve intoxication or desired effect, or markedly diminished effect with continued use of the same amount.

a. Have you ever found you had to use more to get high than you did when you first started using drugs?
INTERVIEWER: If no, SKIP to Characteristic Withdrawal.
b. With which drug(s) has that happened? (see below)

Characteristic withdrawal symptoms (drugs)

a. When you stopped or cut back on drugs, was there any change in how you felt? Did you feel sick in any way? Did your sleep change?
INTERVIEWER: If no, SKIP to Substance Taken to Relieve.
b. With which drug has that happened?

Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Insomnia | 2, Sweat | 3, Flushing | 4, Gooseflesh | 5, Runny Nose | 6, Stomach Cramps | 7, Diarrhea | 8, Nausea | 9, Muscle Pains | 10, Twitching

Other Characteristics.
 
I'd like to ask you some more questions about your drug use.

What drug(s) do you prefer if availability were no problem?
Did you ever 'go straight' and stop doing any drugs for a month or more?
What is the longest you went without drugs?
Which of these drugs have you used in the past six months?

DISTRESS/IMPAIRMENT

Please look at the thermometer/scale. 

INTERVIEWER: Remind child how to use scale, if necessary.
How much did doing this/these drug(s) upset or bother you?
How much has the drug use you have told me about caused problems for you at home, at school, or with your family or friends?
Did you miss school to go use or because you were high?
How old were you the last time you used (list drug)?
Since you were (age of onset), was there ever a time when you were not using (list drug)?
What was the longest period of time that you did not have these concerns?
Did anyone, like a teacher or family member, suggest that you get help for your drug use?
Did you ever go to see a doctor, nurse, social worker, psychologist, school counselor, minister/priest or other professional to get help for (list drugs)?

If from multiple people:
 Who did you get help from the first time?
How old were you the first time you got help?
If no, how old were you the last time you got help?
